title: Nested error pages do not render without a `+page.svelte`
body:
### Describe the bug

After running migration, the old page `load` function that returned a `404` is transformed into an equivalent `+server.js` file. However, this only causes a `json` to be returned instead of rendering the nested error page.

I've tried returning a 404 from a `+page.js` load function but the result is the same as above.

Currently, I've only been successful by using a combination of throwing 404 from `+page.js` and adding an empty `+page.svelte` file.

Perhaps this requires a change of behaviour or a clarification in the docs.

See: https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/advanced-routing#rest-parameters
> ...the marx-brothers/+error.svelte file will not be rendered if you visit /marx-brothers/karl, because no route was matched. If you want to render the nested error page, you should create a route that matches any /marx-brothers/* request, and return a 404 from it:
> ```
> src/routes/
> ├ marx-brothers/
> | ├ [...path]/
> │ ├ chico/
> │ ├ harpo/
> │ ├ groucho/
> │ └ +error.svelte
> └ +error.svelte
> ```

### Reproduction

https://github.com/s3812497/sveltekit-nested-error-pages-bug
